summary: Jeffrey Facter was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are primarily payroll records and personnel records related to his employment. These records include payroll certifications detailing his salary and pay periods, as well as payroll authorizations and leave records. The documents span from December 1976 to December 1977, indicating his period of employment with the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Jeffrey Facter's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the available documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on the payroll indicates he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations. Further research would be needed to determine the specific nature and importance of his contributions to the HSCA's investigation.
